definitions.definition: a pattern of spirals or concentric circles.
examples: Shelley drew larger and larger dark whorls on her notepad

definitions.definition: each of the turns or convolutions in the shell of a gastropod or ammonoid mollusk.
a set of leaves, flowers, or branches springing from the stem at the same level and encircling it.
(in a flower) each of the sets of organs, especially the petals and sepals, arranged concentrically around the receptacle.
a complete circle in a fingerprint.
a small wheel or pulley in a spinning wheel, spinning machine, or spindle.
spiral or move in a twisted and convoluted fashion.
examples: the dances are kinetic kaleidoscopes where steps whorl into wildness
